data.title: Real Madrid vs Osasuna score, result, highlights as Rodrygo leads Blancos to 2023 Copa del Rey title
data.meta_description: Real Madrid have secured the 2022/23 Copa del Rey title as two goals from Rodrygo Goes sealed a 2-1 win over Osasuna.
data.text:
Real Madrid have sealed a Copa del Rey title for the first time since 2014 as they beat Osasuna 2-1 in the 2023 final at the Estadio de La Cartuja.

Carlo Ancelotti's side picked up their first major trophy of the season, ahead of a midweek Champions League semmifinal against Manchester City, with a battling showing against Osasuna.

Rodrygo Goes' quickfire opener looked to set Los Blancos up for a dominant night in Andalucia but they were pushed hard by Jagoba Arrasate's underdogs.

Lucas Torro's second half thunderbolt deservedly forced Osasuna back into the contest, before Rodrygo kept his calm once again inside the box, to ease Real Madrid over the line.

MORE: How many trophies has Carlo Ancelotti won in his career?

<

Real Madrid vs Osasuna final score

Final Real Madrid 2 Osasuna 1

Goals:

RMA — Rodrygo (Vini Jr) — 2nd min.

OSA — Torro — 59th min.

RMA — Rodrygo (Vini Jr) — 71st min.

Lineups:

Real Madrid (4-3-3): Courtois (GK) — Carvajal, Militao, Alaba, Camavinga — Kroos, Tchouameni, Valverde — Rodrygo, Benzema, Vinicius Jr

Osasuna (4-2-3-1): Herrera (GK) — Herrera, Pena, Hernandez, Garcia, Cruz — Moncoyla, Torres — Ezzalzouli, Oroz, Gomez — Budimir

Big game Rodrygo ready for City start

Rodrygo has developed a reputation for scoring big goals at key times since he netted on his Real Madrid debut in 2019. Ancelotti has continued to place increased faith in the Brazilian international, and he has developed physically and technically in the last 12 months.

Three Champions League knockout goals last season saw him play a central role in Real Madrid winning the competition, but his consistency and goal output has gone up a level in 2022/23, with 16 now scored in all competitions.

Ancelotti has previously opted for Fede Valverde's combativeness in his Champions League attacking trios, but Rodrygo's form, and dead-eye ability in front of goal, make him a certainty to start against Manchester City in the first leg of their UEFA Champions League semifinal.

Key for Real Madrid Copa del Rey title

Spanish veteran right-back Dani Carvajal survived a few scares against Barcelona loanee Abde Ezzalzouli of Osasuna to turn in a dogged defensive performance.

Three key tackles prevented Osasuna from forcing themselves back into the contest and his experience and fight will be needed up against Manchester City's Jack Grealish and Bernardo Silva.

On the opposite flank, French star Eduardo Camavinga continued to calmly impress as an emergency left-back, with Ferland Mendy still not fit.

Mendy and Nacho Fernandez are more natural picks to play the position, but Camavainga's recovery pace and ability to link in with midfield will keep him in the starting team.

Real Madrid vs Osasuna highlights from Copa del Rey final

Final: Real Madrid 2-1 Osasuna

Real Madrid are Copa del Rey champions.

Carvajal earns his plaudits with another key tackle right at the death, but it's Rodrygo's double that will steal the headlines, as Real Madrid lift the Copa del Rey for the first time since 2014.

Up next: the UEFA Champions League and Manchester City!

90+4 mins: All the tricks from Real Madrid here as Valverde is booked for a foul and Courtois for timewasting.

90 mins: Five minutes added on......can Osasuna find a winner?

85 mins: The clock keeps ticking, as Rudiger heads Modric's corner over, and a frustrated Barja picks up a booking.

82 mins: Ancelotti is looking to close the game out, with Luka Modric on for Kroos, and Alaba wins a free kick.

74 mins: Alaba goes for a spectacular volley...which flies over!

More changes from Arrasate as Kike Barja and Ruben Pena come on for Ezzalzouli and Ruben Garcia.

71 mins: GOAL Real Madrid. RODRYGO!!!

Rinse and repeat from Real Madrid's opener as Vini Jr drives into the box, Kroos' blast is block, and Rodrgyo stays alive dink Los Blancos back in front!!

Watch in UK:

Watch in USA:

70 mins: Changes from both sides as Antonio Rudiger comes on for Aurelien Tchouameni and Chimy Avila replaces Budimir.

66 mins: Real Madrid using their experience here as Benzema almost tees up Fed Valverde for an instant response!

62 mins: The Osasuna red wall have stopped play with flares on the pitch as game takes a quick breather!

59 mins: GOAL Osasuna. It's a 1-1 equaliser!

The visitors have been pushing and they get their reward!!! Los Blancos are slow to close down on the edge of the box and Lucas Torre lashes one past Courtois!

GAME ON!

Watch in UK:

Watch in USA:

55 mins: We have stepped up a gear again....and all the key names are back to the forefront!!

Rodrygo, on to Benzema, to Vini Jr.....but wide.

Osasuna break and the dependable Carvajal sprints back to thwart an Osasuna attack.

50 mins: No changes from either side at the break as Carvajal gets across to snuff out the threat of Ezzalzouli.

Real Madrid then carve out a half chance at the other end but Benzema lashes over the bar!

46 mins: Back underway for the second half.

Halftime: Real Madrid 1-0 Osasuna

Osasuna's game plan is yet to really click into place as Los Blancos lead 1-0 at the break via Rodrygo's early goal.

Vini Jr is the key for Ancelotti's side, but with just one goal to overturn, Arrasate's Osasuna will not be panicking.

45 mins: Flashpoint at the end of the referee, Vini Jr picks up a booking for arguing with the referee over a penalty claim, and Garcia clashes with the Brazilian in the aftermath.

41 mins: It's a Real Madrid player's turn to go into the book now, as Militao clumsily brings down Aimar Oroz.

37 mins: Another booking for Osasuna, as David Garcia tangles with Benzema, and the frustration for the underdogs grows.

33 mins: Real Madrid chance! What a hit!

Real Madrid win a free kick on the edge of the Osasuna box, and David Alaba's thunderbolt has Herrera beaten, but his strike cannons back off the crossbar!!

Watch in USA:

28 mins: Chance Osasuna!

Carvajal to the rescue again for Real Madrid......Barcelona loanee Abde Ezzazouli keeps his cool to chip over Courtois, but Carvajal sticks to his task to get back and sweep up!

Watch in USA:

25 mins: Quick as a flash, Dani Carvajal gets back to clear away an Osasuna chance, and Real Madrid work a chance to Benzema on the edge of the box, but Sergio Herrera gets down to make an important save!!

Lightning stuff from Los Blancos!

Watch in UK:

21 mins: First booking of the night, as Jon Moncayola pulls back Vini Jr, and picks up a caution.

17 mins: Real Madrid look to try a more direct approach, with Toni Kroos' long ball in behind, but Vini Jr cannot catch it!

12 mins: The pattern looks set now, Osasuna edge forward, and Vini Jr and co wait to raid on the counter attack!

7 mins: Osasuna have done well to settle from that setback, and force a corner, with Thibaut Courtois called into action, to hold Ante Budimir's header.

2 mins: Goal Real Madrid! WHAT A START!

Vinicius Junior does brilliantly to trick his way past two tackles inside the Osasuna box and his cut back if buried by Rodrygo!!

Watch in UK:

Watch in USA:

Kickoff: It's Real Madrid vs. Osasuna from Seville, Spain.

15 mins from kickoff: The marathon men from Pamplona!

Osasuna are fully embracing their underdog role in the final and Arrasate's side have shown real grit on route to the final.

They have come through FOUR successive extra time wins in the previous rounds, to edge out Gimnastic, Real Betis, Sevilla and Athletic Club......could extra time be on the cards tonight?

30 mins from kickoff: Mr Copa del Rey!!

Kike Garcia has been the main man for Osasuna in the 2022/23 Copa del Rey, with five goals, and Jagoba Arrasate will be certain to use him from the bench tonight.

1 hr from kickoff: TEAM NEWS IS IN!!!

Ancelotti has City on his mind in terms of his starting XI, but Brazilian duo Vinicius Jr and Rodrygo both start, either side of Benzema.

Chimy Avila starts on the bench for Osasuna, with Ante Budimir the key man in attack, as Arrasate's side look to shock Ancelotti.

1hr 30 mins: Can Osasuna pull off a shock?

The Osasuna fans roared their team off on the road to Sevilla and Jagoba Arrsate's team will be looking to make history tonight.

2 hrs from kickoff: Big Game Benzema!

Los Blancos captain Karim Benzema scored a hat trick in the 4-0 semifinal second leg win over Barcelona — will he be the difference maker again tonight?

Real Madrid vs Osasuna lineups

Ancelotti has a full squad to pick from for the final, but Luka Modric is rested ahead

Real Madrid starting lineup (4-3-3): Courtois (GK) — Carvajal, Militao, Alaba, Camavinga — Kroos, Tchouameni, Valverde — Rodrygo, Benzema, Vinicius Jr

Real Madrid subs (10): Lunin (GK), Vallejo, Nacho, Modric, Hazard, Asensio, Odriozola, Vazquez, Ceballos, Diaz

Osasuna boss Jagoba Arrasate rested some key names for the 1-0 midweek loss to Barcelona, and he will be boosted by the returns of Argentine forward Ezequiel 'Chimy' Avila and winger Kike Barja.

Osasuna starting lineup (4-2-3-1): Herrera (GK) — Herrera, Pena, Hernandez, Garcia, Cruz — Moncoyla, Torres — Ezzalzouli, Oroz, Gomez — Budimir

Osasuna subs (9): Fernandez (GK), Garcia, Avila, Barja, Santos, Garcia, Ibanez, Sanchez, Oroz, Munoz, Moreno
